009package Ch11_Circle_Ellipse_Fitting;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.gui.NewImage;
014import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project.ConfocalConicEllipseProjector;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project.EllipseProjector;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project.OrthogonalEllipseProjector;
020import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
022import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
023
024import java.awt.Color;
025import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
026import java.util.Random;
027
028import static java.lang.Math.PI;
029
030/**
031 * <p>
032 * This plugin creates a new image with an ellipse and a set of random points. For each point, the closest (contact)
033 * point on the ellipse is calculated and a connecting line is drawn to a vector overlay. Two closest-point algorithms
034 * are available (see Secs. 11.2.2 and 11.2.3 of [1] for additional details):
035 * </p>
036 * <ol>
037 * <li> orthogonal, exact closest point (exact but iterative) and </li>
038 * <li> approximate confocal conic closest point estimation (only approximate but non-iterative).</li>
039 * </ol>
040 * <p>
041 * The random seed may be specified for repeatability of experiments.
042 * </p>
043 * <p>
044 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
045 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
046 * </p>
047 *
048 * @author WB
049 */
050public class Ellipse_Closest_Points_Demo implements PlugIn {
051        
052        private static int W = 400;
053        private static int H = 400;
054        private static int N = 250;
055        private static int Seed = 0;
056        
057        private static final double StrokeWidth = 1.0;
058        private static final Color EllipseColor = Color.green;
059        private static final Color PointColor = Color.blue;
060        private static ClosestPointAlgorithm Algorithm = ClosestPointAlgorithm.Orthogonal;
061        
062        public enum ClosestPointAlgorithm {
063                Orthogonal, ConfocalConics
064        }
065        
066        @Override
067        public void run(String arg) {
068                
069                if (!runDialog()) {
070                        return;
071                }
072                
073                //GeometricEllipse realEllipse = new GeometricEllipse(170, 120, 200, 190, PI/7);                // example 1
074                GeometricEllipse realEllipse = new GeometricEllipse(1100, 120, 25, 1200, PI/2 + 0.2);   // example 2
075                
076                String title = this.getClass().getSimpleName() + " (" + Algorithm.toString() + ")";
077                ImagePlus im = NewImage.createByteImage(title, W, H, 1, NewImage.FILL_WHITE);
078                
079                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
080                
081                ColoredStroke ellipseStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, EllipseColor);
082                ColoredStroke pointStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, PointColor);
083                ola.addShapes(realEllipse.getShapes(), ellipseStroke);
084                
085                EllipseProjector projector = null;
086                switch (Algorithm) {
087                case Orthogonal:
088                        projector = new OrthogonalEllipseProjector(realEllipse);
089                        break;
090                case ConfocalConics:
091                        projector = new ConfocalConicEllipseProjector(realEllipse);
092                        break;
093                }
094                
095                Random rd = (Seed == 0) ? new Random() : new Random(Seed);
096
097                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
098                        Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(W * rd.nextDouble(), H* rd.nextDouble());
099                        Pnt2d p0 = projector.project(p);
100                        // draw connecting line:
101                        Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
102                        path.moveTo(p.getX(), p.getY());
103                        path.lineTo(p0.getX(), p0.getY());
104                        ola.addShape(path);
105                        // draw point p:
106                        ola.addShape(p.getShape(), pointStroke);
107                }
108                
109                im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
110                im.show();
111        }
112
113        private boolean runDialog() {
114                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
115                
116                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
117                                "This plugin creates a new image with an ellipse and a",
118                                "set of random points. For each point, the closest (contact)",
119                                "point on the ellipse is calculated and a connecting line",
120                                "is drawn to a vector overlay."
121                                ));
122                
123                gd.addNumericField("Number of random points", N, 0);
124                gd.addNumericField("Random seed (0 = none)", Seed, 0);
125                gd.addEnumChoice("Closest-point method", Algorithm);
126                
127                gd.showDialog();
128                if (gd.wasCanceled())
129                        return false;
130                
131                N = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
132                Seed = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
133                Algorithm = gd.getNextEnumChoice(ClosestPointAlgorithm.class);
134                
135                return true;
136        }
137        
138}
